messages.title: Your Choice for the Economy
messages.content: Support for jobs, businesses and home-owners during the recovery. 50% tax for highest earners.

messages.title: Your Choice on Crime
messages.content: Under Labour, crime is down by 24% in Spennymoor in the last year. Police funding UP by 31% in Durham. Police Service funding UP by 70%. Neighbourhood policing teams in your communities.

messages.title: Working Hard for You
messages.content: As a Minister at the Department of Work & Pensions responsible for: The Child Poverty Bill, Cold Weather Payments, Support for Mortgage Interest, Reforming Housing Benefit and clamping down on benefit fraud.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour supports jobs, businesses, and homeowners during the recovery and proposes a 50% tax for the highest earners.
Labour's record under Helen Goodman shows a reduction in crime, increased police funding, and strong support for neighbourhood policing teams.
Labour introduced The Child Poverty Bill to make it a legal requirement to abolish child poverty by 2020.
The payments were tripled to £25 pw and paid out to over 7,500 local households four times this winter.
Support for Mortgage Interest (SMI) has helped 220,000 households so that the current rate of repossessions is half that of the Tory recessions of the 1980s and 1990s.
Labour is reforming Housing Benefit and clamping down on benefit fraud.

housing.content: Reforming Housing Benefit and clamping down on benefit fraud.

leaflet.personalStatement: Thank you for your help with our recent problem... we are convinced that it was your input that brought an early conclusion.

politicalExperience.role: Minister at the Department of Work & Pensions
politicalExperience.achievements: Responsible for The Child Poverty Bill, Cold Weather Payments, Support for Mortgage Interest and Reforming Housing Benefit.
